portfolio.title: Tanaloa
portfolio.description: Adobe XD, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop
portfolio.longDescription: Tanaloa is an application for women that helps them find a roomie among other women. Whether they are on vacation, moving from parent's home or just wanting to know how living with another person is, this will help them not only in the logistics of accommodation and money, but give them a safe place and environment to stay. It was born because I wanted to make something unique and useful for a target audience that is constantly in danger. Women are a delicate population in terms of safety and freedom, they need a really safe space for this kind of needs.This idea had a concise but complex process since I embraced all the stages of Design Thinking methodology (Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype and Test). I developed all of these stages cautiously and at a great level of detail, with the result being really successful.

portfolio.title: Urania
portfolio.description: Adobe XD, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop
portfolio.longDescription: Urania is a web application that was made for a challenge on how could I make an UI to visualize the ISS and pictures of its current location along with the data of the current location. //This challenge was for a position in an important company. The challenged not only required UI design but also coding it end-to-end (back-end and front-end). //Creating something for this particular scenario was a little hard since the topic is quite plain and the imagination played a crucial role here. //Hoosing elements to design this web application was crucial to give it identity and style. I took the name from a god from Egypt and gave it a professional look without leaving the usability behind.

portfolio.title: Potato Gifts
portfolio.longDescription: Potato Gifts was a challenge I made to apply to a company. Basically you was asked to build a customer loyalty system where you can change products with your potapoints. //The project needed to be attractive and catchy enough so the user can actively win points and receive great products in exchange. //The combination of something as important as this kind of clients system and the use of a potato as the most visible element, were the main attraction for this system. //For the development, I decided to dive in a new technology: React.
